HWInfo was reporting VRM temps that were up to 10C lower than temps measured on the backside of the PCB
HWInfo: "Your VRMs are a chill 50C :D"
PCB Backside: "Pffffft, plz.  It's 60C back here"
And for reference, in his testing, the temps measured via HWInfo, MOSFET, and PCB Backside were all generally within 1 - 5C of each other
Except for ASUS
Oh yeah some of those temp sensors on the motherboard get scary hot near the CPU.
HWInfo I've never heard of, HWMonitor is really cool and extensive, including voltages and fan speeds.
Made by the same folks as CPU-Z.
So, apparently the critical temperature for VRMs is 125C

My biggest complaint is actually the time limit on holiday skins

yeah I don't like the trend of temporary exclusives in technology.
So here's the breakdown on Overwatch exclusives
Common - Epic, nobody gives a shit.  Legendaries have a drop rate of about 1 in every 12 boxes
I already gave out the coin drops for dupes / chests
Holiday skins added to the loot table for that holiday cost 3x the normal price
You get a second chance in a given year at them during the anniversary event, when all holiday skins are unlockable
After a year has passed, holiday skins cost normal price
Players earn 1 box per level, and can earn an addition 3 boxes per week from winning 9 arcade games, and in the event of new arcade modes, 1 box for the first match
Still lootboxes, but Blizzard has done what they can to make them pretty consumer friendly
On that note, inb4 Activision tomfuckery
